unnormalised: **Automotive News: Traffic Chaos to Get a Little Less Chaotic?**
normalised: **Automotive News: Traffic Chaos to Get a Little Less Chaotic?**

unnormalised: Bangalore drivers, rejoice (maybe)! New traffic regulations are finally hitting the streets, and hopefully, they'll be more effective than Bengaluru's perpetually delayed Metro.
normalised: Bangalore drivers, rejoice (maybe)! New traffic regulations are finally hitting the streets, and hopefully, they'll be more effective than Bengaluru's perpetually delayed Metro.

unnormalised: Dr. Patil, the Traffic Commissioner, announced these changes last Tuesday. Key highlights include stricter enforcement against lane cutting, especially near Silk Board. Rs. 500 fines are promised, with cameras watching.
normalised: Doctor Patil, the Traffic Commissioner, announced these changes last Tuesday. Key highlights include stricter enforcement against lane cutting, especially near Silk Board. Rupee five hundred fines are promised, with cameras watching.

unnormalised: Also, the rules are now tighter on parking within 500 meters of major intersections. Expect your car to be towed if you're caught; hefty fines will follow. Authorities are also cracking down on unauthorized hawkers setting up shop on pavements, freeing up some pedestrian space.
normalised: Also, the rules are now tighter on parking within five hundred meters of major intersections. Expect your car to be towed if you're caught; hefty fines will follow. Authorities are also cracking down on unauthorized hawkers setting up shop on pavements, freeing up some pedestrian space.

unnormalised: Think of it as a Diwali gift, but instead of sweets, it's the (slim) chance of reaching work on time. Let's see if these rules can actually manage to untangle the daily jam at places like Hebbal flyover! Fingers crossed they also address those crazy U-turns in Koramangala! Maybe even reclaim some of the encroached public land, like that temple expanding illegally over 100 sq ft.
normalised: Think of it as a Diwali gift, but instead of sweets, it's the (slim) chance of reaching work on time. Let's see if these rules can actually manage to untangle the daily jam at places like Hebbal flyover! Fingers crossed they also address those crazy U-turns in Koramangala! Maybe even reclaim some of the encroached public land, like that temple expanding illegally over one hundred square feet.
